channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CXF-6145] WS-RM demo server throws exception
item.description:
Dec 8, 2014 10:04:56 AM org.apache.cxf.ws.rm.Proxy invoke
SEVERE: Failed to send RM protocol message

{http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/02/rm}

SequenceAcknowledgement.
org.apache.cxf.interceptor.Fault: Could not send Message.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
What happens is that when server receives RM protocol message

{http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/02/rm}

CloseSequence from client, it asks its Destionation to acknowledge message, which in turn calls DestinationSequence.acknowledge(message) to schedule and defer SequenceAcknowledgement for this message. Problem is that in addition to the scheduled SequenceAcknowledgement, Destination also immediately sends a SequenceAcknowledgement back to client. Client then immediately receives the SequenceAcknowledgement from server and TerminateSequence. When timer for server scheduled SequenceAcknowledgement for LastMessage is on, the client is already shutdown, hence the exception is thrown.

Proposed fix lies in org.apache.cxf.ws.rm.DestinationSequence -

public void acknowledge(Message message) throws SequenceFault {
    RMProperties rmps = RMContextUtils.retrieveRMProperties(message, false);
    SequenceType st = rmps.getSequence();
    ...
    RMEndpoint reliableEndpoint = destination.getReliableEndpoint();
    RMConfiguration cfg = reliableEndpoint.getConfiguration();

-    scheduleAcknowledgement(cfg.getAcknowledgementIntervalTime());

+    if (null == rmps.getCloseSequence()) {
+        scheduleAcknowledgement(cfg.getAcknowledgementIntervalTime());
+    }

    long inactivityTimeout = cfg.getInactivityTimeoutTime();
    scheduleSequenceTermination(inactivityTimeout);
}

This issue needs to be analyzed before making a quick fix.

If you saw the CloseSequence message while using WS-RM 1.0, that's not a good sign because RM 1.0 (http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/02/rm) has no CloseSequence.

I saw a few inconsistency when the RM 1.1 implementation was added to CXF, but I thought they have been mostly fixed.

Hi Akitoshi,

The "CloseSequence" message on wire is "LastMessage" -

Address: http://localhost:9000/SoapContext/GreeterPort
Encoding: UTF-8
Http-Method: POST
Content-Type: text/xml; charset=UTF-8
Headers: {Accept=[*/*], Cache-Control=[no-cache], connection=[keep-alive], Content-Length=[798], content-type=[text/xml; charset=UTF-8], Host=[localhost:9000], Pragma=[no-cache], SOAPAction=["http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/02/rm/LastMessage"], User-Agent=[Apache CXF 3.0.2]}
Payload: <soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"><soap:Header><Action xmlns="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2004/08/addressing">http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/02/rm/LastMessage</Action><MessageID xmlns="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2004/08/addressing">urn:uuid:d56f2001-80a8-4d30-a272-ff48eeca2a44</MessageID><To xmlns="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2004/08/addressing">http://localhost:9000/SoapContext/GreeterPort</To><wsrm:Sequence soap:mustUnderstand="1" xmlns:ns2="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2004/08/addressing" xmlns:wsrm="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/02/rm"><wsrm:Identifier>urn:uuid:2917954a-e7db-4410-9a59-a3362b03fdb5</wsrm:Identifier><wsrm:MessageNumber>2</wsrm:MessageNumber><wsrm:LastMessage/></wsrm:Sequence></soap:Header><soap:Body/></soap:Envelope>

You pointed out a valid point. I do see MessageInfo is putting 1.0 namespace for CloseSequence. This might be another issue but I havent seen any runtime error yet. 

{org.apache.cxf.service.model.MessageInfo=[MessageInfo INPUT: {http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/02/rm}CloseSequence], org.apache.cxf.message.Message.PROTOCOL_HEADERS={Accept=[*/*], Cache-Control=[no-cache], connection=[keep-alive], Content-Length=[798], content-type=[text/xml; charset=UTF-8], Host=[localhost:9000], Pragma=[no-cache], SOAPAction=["http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/02/rm/LastMessage"]

Hi Akitoshi,

The immediate SequenceAcknowledgement is sent out by org.apache.cxf.ws.rm.Destination after "seq.acknowledge(message);" -

    public void acknowledge(Message message) throws SequenceFault, RMException {
                ...    
                seq.acknowledge(message);

                if (null != rmps.getCloseSequence()) {
                    seq.setLastMessageNumber(sequenceType.getMessageNumber());
                    ackImmediately(seq, message);
                }
               ...
... and the duplicate SequenceAcknowledgement is scheduled by "seq.acknowledge(message);" in above snippet code
Also the on-wire LastMessage log was produced in my simplified test case which only contain one application greetMeOneWay request. In original demo the MessageNumber of LastMessage is 5

GitHub user gwuireland opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/cxf/pull/41

CXF-6145

WS-RM demo server throws exception

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/gwuireland/cxf 3.0.x-fixes

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/cxf/pull/41.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #41

commit 1343a8427820260197ad03a59efb2d95cd91e686
Author: gwuireland <gwuireland@gmail.com>
Date: 2014-12-12T11:37:47Z

CXF-6145

WS-RM demo server throws exception

@Guopu,
Okay.
If the code is sending back an immediate ack for the last/close message, it's reasonable to skip the block that is sending another ack. We just need to make sure that the ack will be sent back when the client resends the close (or the last message) again when it didn't receive the ack so that the client will get one at the end.

@Dennis,
how do you think of the proposed patch?

regards, aki

Yes, I think this makes sense.

I've seen this happen, too, with the continued attempts to send an acknowledgment after the sequence was closed. It doesn't actually effect the operation, but it's an annoyance and no doubt disconcerting to users to see the exceptions in the log.

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/cxf/pull/41
